About.title: The AhlulBayt Assembly of Kenya
About.intro: The Ahlul Bayt (a.s) Assembly of Kenya (ABAK) is a non-profit organization committed to promoting the noble teachings of Islam as conveyed by the Ahlul Bayt (a.s), the pure progeny of our beloved
About.intro2: Our goal is to foster success in both this life and the hereafter, by sharing these teachings with the broader community.

values.description: The AhlulBayt Assembly is built upon six foundational principles that shape our mission, actions, and community.

mission.title: Mission
mission.description: To establish institutions and channels that propagate Islam to everyone, offering guidance for practicing the faith as taught by the Prophet (s.a.w.w) and his Ahlul Bayt (a.s).

vision.description: To build a strong, prosperous community, improving the well-being of Kenyan society in all aspects of life.

QuranReflections.heroSubtitle: Discover deep reflections and lessons from the Holy Qur’an to guide your daily life.

patience.title: Patience in the Face of Trials
patience.text: Indeed, Allah is with those who are patient. This verse reminds us that trials are not punishments but opportunities to grow spiritually.

trust.title: Trusting Allah's Plan
trust.text: Nothing will happen to us except what Allah has decreed. This helps believers let go of anxiety and embrace divine will.

forgiveness.title: The Power of Forgiveness
forgiveness.text: Do you not wish that Allah should forgive you? We’re encouraged to forgive others to receive divine mercy in return.

about.title: About Us
about.name: The AhlulBayt Assembly of Kenya (ABAK)
about.description: ABAK is a faith-based non-profit organization committed to spreading the noble teachings of the Holy Qur'an, Prophet Muhammad (s.a.w.w), and the AhlulBayt (a.s). We strive to foster a spiritually aware and compassionate society through education, outreach, and empowerment.
about.mission: To invite all people to the true path as presented by the Qur'an and the teachings of the Final Messenger, Prophet Muhammad (s.a.w.w), and his purified progeny—the AhlulBayt (a.s).
about.vision: To nurture a united, just, and spiritually enriched Kenyan society grounded in the ethics and values of Islam.

leadership.title: Leadership Structure
leadership.description: Our leadership structure reflects our commitment to integrity, collaboration, and service. Each office plays a vital role in guiding the organization towards its mission and vision.

chairman.title: Chairman
chairman.description: Provides overall leadership and chairs organizational meetings.

viceChairman.title: Vice Chairman
viceChairman.description: Supports the Chairman and assumes duties in their absence.

treasurer.title: Treasurer
treasurer.description: Oversees financial planning, budgeting, and reporting.

secretary.title: Secretary
secretary.description: Maintains records and ensures communication within the organization.

boardMembers.title: Board Members
boardMembers.description: Contribute to decision-making and uphold the mission and values.

programs.objectivesDescription: At the AhlulBayt Assembly of Kenya (ABAK), our mission is guided by a series of well-defined programs and objectives. These focus on spiritual guidance, community development, education, and empowerment. Each objective represents a step toward creating a more informed, unified, and compassionate society rooted in the teachings of the Ahlul Bayt (a.s).

hawza.title: Hawza Seyyidah Zeinab
hawza.subtitle: A journey into Islamic knowledge and leadership

about.title: About the Hawza
about.subtitle: A Thriving Center for Islamic Learning
about.description: The Hawzah Seyyidah Zeinab (s.a) is an esteemed Islamic educational institution established by the Ahlulbayt Assembly of Kenya (ABAK). It provides a nurturing environment for young women to deepen their knowledge and understanding of the Islamic faith.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: To develop a new generation of well-grounded, knowledgeable, and spiritually committed female Islamic scholars who will contribute meaningfully to the community and uphold the teachings of the Ahlulbayt (a.s).

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To provide high-quality Islamic education rooted in the teachings of the Holy Qur’an and Ahlulbayt (a.s), empowering young women with knowledge, moral values, and leadership skills..

impact.title: Our Impact
impact.description: Since its inception, the Hawza has empowered dozens of young women, many of whom now actively serve in various religious, educational, and social capacities within their communities across Kenya.

criteria.title: Educational Background
criteria.description: Applicants must have successfully completed high school and earned their KCSE certification.

criteria.title: Age Requirement
criteria.description: Students must be at least 18 years of age to be eligible for admission.

criteria.title: Commitment to Learning
criteria.description: A strong passion for Islamic studies and a dedication to academic excellence are essential.

profile.title: Diverse Backgrounds
profile.description: Students come from various regions and socioeconomic backgrounds, fostering a rich and inclusive learning environment.

profile.title: Academic Achievements
profile.description: Selected students demonstrate exceptional academic performance, most achieving top KCSE scores.

profile.title: Shared Passion
profile.description: Each student shares a deep commitment to Islamic studies and leadership in their communities.

items.title: Core Curriculum
items.description: Students receive a well-rounded foundation in Islamic studies and community leadership.

items.title: Specialized Tracks
items.description: Focused study in Islamic history, Arabic language, and interfaith dialogue.

items.title: Practical Training
items.description: Hands-on workshops and internships that build leadership and community service skills.

items.title: Extensive Library
items.description: A vast collection of Islamic texts, journals, and digital resources.

items.title: Lecture Halls
items.description: Modern halls equipped with educational tech for interactive learning.

items.title: Computer Labs
items.description: Digital workspaces for writing, research, and skill development.

items.title: Prayer Facilities
items.description: Spacious and serene spaces for daily prayers and spiritual growth.
